DOC.brief_summary: At academic tertiary referral center , patient pelvic floor dysfunction , schedule outpatient cystoscopy urodynamic testing ask participate study . Patients call one day examination ask pain general state health . The purpose study investigate pain perception urogynecologic patient outpatient cystoscopy compare pain perception outpatient urodynamic . The investigator also investigate difference anticipate actual pain perception . The investigator test null hypothesis difference patients´ pain perception outpatient cystoscopy urodynamic testing . The secondary hypothesis difference patients´ anticipate amount pain actually experience pain cystoscopy urodynamic testing . According power calculation , sample size 52 patient per group need detect 2 cm difference pain score VAS - judge clinically significant difference - 95 % power two-sided significance level 0.05 . Exclusion criterion : age ≤ 18 year , insufficient ability understand German , pregnancy participation another clinical study time .
DOC.brief_title: Pain-perception During Outpatient cystoscopy-a Prospective Controlled Study
DOC.criteria: woman undergo cystoscopy urodynamic test academic tertiary referral center . age ≤ 18 year insufficient ability understand German pregnancy participation another clinical study time
